document.docAuthor: Li, Dengqing, Liu, Hao & Xu, Xin
document.docTitle: Songthela pyriformis Li & Liu & Xu 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of the primitively segmented spiders from Mt Yuelu, Hunan, China (Mesothelae, Liphistiidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of the primitively segmented spiders from Mt Yuelu, Hunan, China (Mesothelae, Liphistiidae)

.

Diagnosis. Males of
S. pyriformis
sp. nov. resemble those of
S. ciliensis ( Yin, Tang & Xu, 2003 )
, but can be distinguished from the latter by the conductor with a slightly bent apical spine ( Fig. 5 A–B, D–E, G), and by the middle region of the marginal apophysis being curved ( Fig. 5B, G ); from those of other
Songthela
species by the conductor with one slightly bent and smooth apical spine ( Fig. 5 A–G). Females of
S. pyriformis
sp. nov. differ from those of other
Songthela
species by the lateral pair of receptacular clusters situated slight dorsolaterally of the bursa copulatrix in ventral view, the median pairs with long genital stalks, and smaller than the lateral pairs ( Fig. 5 K–M).

Description. Male holotype (XUX–2011–033).
Carapace deep yellow with several hairs in margin; opisthosoma light brown; tergites dark brown; sternum narrow, much longer than wide; few fine pointed hairs running over ocular area; chelicerae robust with promargin of cheliceral groove with 11 denticles; legs with sturdy hairs and spines; opisthosoma with 12 tergites, second to fifth larger than remaining and fourth largest; 7 spinnerets. Measurements: BL 10.17, CL 4.60, CW 4.22, OL 5.10, OW 3.85; ALE> PLE> PME> AME; leg I 12.80 (3.61 + 1.72 + 2.33 + 3.34 + 1.80), leg II 13.54 (3.54 + 1.69 + 2.66 + 3.64 + 2.01), leg III 13.94 (3.48 + 1.60 + 2.37 + 4.23 + 2.26), leg IV 18.91 (4.80 + 1.90 + 3.53 + 5.65 + 3.03).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5. Male and female genital anatomy of
Songthela pyriformis
sp. nov. A–C, male palp, holotype, XUX–2011–033; A, prolateral view; B, ventral view; C, retrolateral view; D–G, male palp, paratype, XUX–2011–020; D, prolateral view; E, ventral view; F, retrolateral view; G, distal view; H–J, female genitalia, dorsal view; K–M, female genitalia, ventral view; H–M, paratypes; H, K, XUX–2011–028; I, L, XUX–2011–024; J, M, XUX–2011–032. Scale bars: A–M, 0.3 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female paratype (XUX–2011–028).
Carapace and opisthosoma color like male; second and third tergites brown, remaining light brown with few brown flecks; sternum narrow; few fine pointed hairs running over ocular area; chelicerae robust with promargin of cheliceral groove with 11 denticles of variable size; legs with sturdy hairs and spines; opisthosoma with 12 tergites, third to fifth larger than remaining and fourth largest; 7 spinnerets. Measurements: BL 9.04, CL 4.43, CW 3.59, OL 3.91, OW 3.12; ALE> PLE> PME> AME; palp 8.33 (2.83 + 1.63 + 1.77 + 2.10), leg I 9.11 (2.81 + 1.64 + 1.73 + 1.76 + 1.17), leg II 8.77 (2.48 + 1.78 + 1.60 + 1.62 + 1.29), leg III 9.32 (2.51 + 1.72 + 1.64 + 2.08 + 1.37), leg IV 12.94 (3.38 + 1.92 + 2.46 + 3.24 + 1.94).
Etymology. The species epithet is taken from the pyriform conductor.

Remarks. The maximum intraspecific genetic distance of
S. pyriformis
sp. nov. is 0.3/0.3% based on K2P and p -distance. The mean intraspecific genetic distance of
S. pyriformis
sp. nov. is 0.1/0.1% (K2P/ p -distance). The closest interspecific genetic distance between
S. pyriformis
sp. nov. and
S. shuyuan
sp. nov. is 16.9/15.0% (K2P/ p -distance), and the closest interspecific genetic distance between
S. pyriformis
sp. nov. and
S. hangzhouensis
is 15.9/14.2% (K2P/ p -distance). The mean interspecific genetic distance between
S. pyriformis
sp. nov. and
S. shuyuan
sp. nov. is 17.7/15.6% (K2P/ p -distance), and the mean interspecific genetic distance between
S. pyriformis
sp. nov. and
S. hangzhouensis
is 15.9/14.2% (K2P/ p -distance).
